00032 /*
00033  * Simple, fast memory allocator for allocating many elements of the same size.
00034  */
00035 
00036 #include "BLI_utildefines.h"
00037 #include "BLI_listbase.h"
00038 
00039 #include "BLI_mempool.h" /* own include */
00040 
00041 #include "DNA_listBase.h"
00042 
00043 #include "MEM_guardedalloc.h"
00044 
00045 #include <string.h>
00046 #include <stdlib.h>
00047 
00048 /* note: copied from BKE_utildefines.h, don't use here because we're in BLI */
00049 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN__
00050 /* Big Endian */
00051 #  define MAKE_ID(a,b,c,d) ( (int)(a)<<24 | (int)(b)<<16 | (c)<<8 | (d) )
00052 #else
00053 /* Little Endian */
00054 #  define MAKE_ID(a,b,c,d) ( (int)(d)<<24 | (int)(c)<<16 | (b)<<8 | (a) )
00055 #endif
00056 
00057 #define FREEWORD MAKE_ID('f', 'r', 'e', 'e')
00058 
00059 typedef struct BLI_freenode {
00060     struct BLI_freenode *next;
00061     int freeword; /* used to identify this as a freed node */
00062 } BLI_freenode;
00063 
00064 typedef struct BLI_mempool_chunk {
00065     struct BLI_mempool_chunk *next, *prev;
00066     void *data;
00067 } BLI_mempool_chunk;
00068 
00069 struct BLI_mempool {
00070     struct ListBase chunks;
00071     int esize;         /* element size in bytes */
00072     int csize;         /* chunk size in bytes */
00073     int pchunk;        /* number of elements per chunk */
00074     int flag;
00075     /* keeps aligned to 16 bits */
00076 
00077     BLI_freenode *free;    /* free element list. Interleaved into chunk datas. */
00078     int totalloc, totused; /* total number of elements allocated in total,
00079                             * and currently in use */
00080 };
00081 
00082 #define MEMPOOL_ELEM_SIZE_MIN (sizeof(void *) * 2)
00083 
00084 BLI_mempool *BLI_mempool_create(int esize, int totelem, int pchunk, int flag)
00085 {
00086     BLI_mempool *pool = NULL;
00087     BLI_freenode *lasttail = NULL, *curnode = NULL;
00088     int i, j, maxchunks;
00089     char *addr;
00090 
00091     /* allocate the pool structure */
00092     if (flag & BLI_MEMPOOL_SYSMALLOC) {
00093         pool = malloc(sizeof(BLI_mempool));
00094     }
00095     else {
00096         pool = MEM_mallocN(sizeof(BLI_mempool), "memory pool");
00097     }
00098 
00099     /* set the elem size */
00100     if (esize < MEMPOOL_ELEM_SIZE_MIN) {
00101         esize = MEMPOOL_ELEM_SIZE_MIN;
00102     }
00103 
00104     if (flag & BLI_MEMPOOL_ALLOW_ITER) {
00105         pool->esize = MAX2(esize, sizeof(BLI_freenode));
00106     }
00107     else {
00108         pool->esize = esize;
00109     }
00110 
00111     pool->flag = flag;
00112     pool->pchunk = pchunk;
00113     pool->csize = esize * pchunk;
00114     pool->chunks.first = pool->chunks.last = NULL;
00115     pool->totused = 0;
00116 
00117     maxchunks = totelem / pchunk + 1;
00118     if (maxchunks == 0) {
00119         maxchunks = 1;
00120     }
00121 
00122     /* allocate the actual chunks */
00123     for (i = 0; i < maxchunks; i++) {
00124         BLI_mempool_chunk *mpchunk;
00125 
00126         if (flag & BLI_MEMPOOL_SYSMALLOC) {
00127             mpchunk = malloc(sizeof(BLI_mempool_chunk));
00128             mpchunk->data = malloc(pool->csize);
00129         }
00130         else {
00131             mpchunk = MEM_mallocN(sizeof(BLI_mempool_chunk), "BLI_Mempool Chunk");
00132             mpchunk->data = MEM_mallocN(pool->csize, "BLI Mempool Chunk Data");
00133         }
00134 
00135         mpchunk->next = mpchunk->prev = NULL;
00136         BLI_addtail(&(pool->chunks), mpchunk);
00137 
00138         if (i == 0) {
00139             pool->free = mpchunk->data; /* start of the list */
00140             if (pool->flag & BLI_MEMPOOL_ALLOW_ITER) {
00141                 pool->free->freeword = FREEWORD;
00142             }
00143         }
00144 
00145         /* loop through the allocated data, building the pointer structures */
00146         for (addr = mpchunk->data, j = 0; j < pool->pchunk; j++) {
00147             curnode = ((BLI_freenode *)addr);
00148             addr += pool->esize;
00149             curnode->next = (BLI_freenode *)addr;
00150             if (pool->flag & BLI_MEMPOOL_ALLOW_ITER) {
00151                 if (j != pool->pchunk - 1)
00152                     curnode->next->freeword = FREEWORD;
00153                 curnode->freeword = FREEWORD;
00154             }
00155         }
00156         /* final pointer in the previously allocated chunk is wrong */
00157         if (lasttail) {
00158             lasttail->next = mpchunk->data;
00159             if (pool->flag & BLI_MEMPOOL_ALLOW_ITER) {
00160                 lasttail->freeword = FREEWORD;
00161             }
00162         }
00163 
00164         /* set the end of this chunks memoryy to the new tail for next iteration */
00165         lasttail = curnode;
00166 
00167         pool->totalloc += pool->pchunk;
00168     }
00169     /* terminate the list */
00170     curnode->next = NULL;
00171     return pool;
00172 }
00173 
00174 void *BLI_mempool_alloc(BLI_mempool *pool)
00175 {
00176     void *retval = NULL;
00177 
00178     pool->totused++;
00179 
00180     if (!(pool->free)) {
00181         BLI_freenode *curnode = NULL;
00182         char *addr;
00183         int j;
00184 
00185         /* need to allocate a new chunk */
00186         BLI_mempool_chunk *mpchunk;
00187 
00188         if (pool->flag & BLI_MEMPOOL_SYSMALLOC) {
00189             mpchunk       = malloc(sizeof(BLI_mempool_chunk));
00190             mpchunk->data = malloc(pool->csize);
00191         }
00192         else {
00193             mpchunk       = MEM_mallocN(sizeof(BLI_mempool_chunk), "BLI_Mempool Chunk");
00194             mpchunk->data = MEM_mallocN(pool->csize, "BLI_Mempool Chunk Data");
00195         }
00196 
00197         mpchunk->next = mpchunk->prev = NULL;
00198         BLI_addtail(&(pool->chunks), mpchunk);
00199 
00200         pool->free = mpchunk->data; /* start of the list */
00201 
00202         if (pool->flag & BLI_MEMPOOL_ALLOW_ITER) {
00203             pool->free->freeword = FREEWORD;
00204         }
00205 
00206         for (addr = mpchunk->data, j = 0; j < pool->pchunk; j++) {
00207             curnode = ((BLI_freenode *)addr);
00208             addr += pool->esize;
00209             curnode->next = (BLI_freenode *)addr;
00210 
00211             if (pool->flag & BLI_MEMPOOL_ALLOW_ITER) {
00212                 curnode->freeword = FREEWORD;
00213                 if (j != pool->pchunk - 1)
00214                     curnode->next->freeword = FREEWORD;
00215             }
00216         }
00217         curnode->next = NULL; /* terminate the list */
00218 
00219         pool->totalloc += pool->pchunk;
00220     }
00221 
00222     retval = pool->free;
00223 
00224     if (pool->flag & BLI_MEMPOOL_ALLOW_ITER) {
00225         pool->free->freeword = 0x7FFFFFFF;
00226     }
00227 
00228     pool->free = pool->free->next;
00229     //memset(retval, 0, pool->esize);
00230     return retval;
00231 }
00232 
00233 void *BLI_mempool_calloc(BLI_mempool *pool)
00234 {
00235     void *retval = BLI_mempool_alloc(pool);
00236     memset(retval, 0, pool->esize);
00237     return retval;
00238 }
00239 
00240 /* doesnt protect against double frees, don't be stupid! */
00241 void BLI_mempool_free(BLI_mempool *pool, void *addr)
00242 {
00243     BLI_freenode *newhead = addr;
00244 
00245     if (pool->flag & BLI_MEMPOOL_ALLOW_ITER) {
00246         newhead->freeword = FREEWORD;
00247     }
00248 
00249     newhead->next = pool->free;
00250     pool->free = newhead;
00251 
00252     pool->totused--;
00253 
00254     /* nothing is in use; free all the chunks except the first */
00255     if (pool->totused == 0) {
00256         BLI_freenode *curnode = NULL;
00257         char *tmpaddr = NULL;
00258         int i;
00259 
00260         BLI_mempool_chunk *mpchunk = NULL;
00261         BLI_mempool_chunk *first = pool->chunks.first;
00262 
00263         BLI_remlink(&pool->chunks, first);
00264 
00265         if (pool->flag & BLI_MEMPOOL_SYSMALLOC) {
00266             for (mpchunk = pool->chunks.first; mpchunk; mpchunk = mpchunk->next) {
00267                 free(mpchunk->data);
00268             }
00269             BLI_freelist(&(pool->chunks));
00270         }
00271         else {
00272             for (mpchunk = pool->chunks.first; mpchunk; mpchunk = mpchunk->next) {
00273                 MEM_freeN(mpchunk->data);
00274             }
00275             BLI_freelistN(&(pool->chunks));
00276         }
00277 
00278         BLI_addtail(&pool->chunks, first);
00279         pool->totalloc = pool->pchunk;
00280 
00281         pool->free = first->data; /* start of the list */
00282         for (tmpaddr = first->data, i = 0; i < pool->pchunk; i++) {
00283             curnode = ((BLI_freenode *)tmpaddr);
00284             tmpaddr += pool->esize;
00285             curnode->next = (BLI_freenode *)tmpaddr;
00286         }
00287         curnode->next = NULL; /* terminate the list */
00288     }
00289 }
00290 
00291 int BLI_mempool_count(BLI_mempool *pool)
00292 {
00293     return pool->totused;
00294 }
00295 
00296 void *BLI_mempool_findelem(BLI_mempool *pool, int index)
00297 {
00298     if (!(pool->flag & BLI_MEMPOOL_ALLOW_ITER)) {
00299         fprintf(stderr, "%s: Error! you can't iterate over this mempool!\n", __func__);
00300         return NULL;
00301     }
00302     else if ((index >= 0) && (index < pool->totused)) {
00303         /* we could have some faster mem chunk stepping code inline */
00304         BLI_mempool_iter iter;
00305         void *elem;
00306         BLI_mempool_iternew(pool, &iter);
00307         for (elem = BLI_mempool_iterstep(&iter); index-- != 0; elem = BLI_mempool_iterstep(&iter)) {
00308             /* do nothing */
00309         };
00310         return elem;
00311     }
00312 
00313     return NULL;
00314 }
00315 
00316 void BLI_mempool_iternew(BLI_mempool *pool, BLI_mempool_iter *iter)
00317 {
00318     if (!(pool->flag & BLI_MEMPOOL_ALLOW_ITER)) {
00319         fprintf(stderr, "%s: Error! you can't iterate over this mempool!\n", __func__);
00320         iter->curchunk = NULL;
00321         iter->curindex = 0;
00322 
00323         return;
00324     }
00325 
00326     iter->pool = pool;
00327     iter->curchunk = pool->chunks.first;
00328     iter->curindex = 0;
00329 }
00330 
00331 #if 0
00332 /* unoptimized, more readable */
00333 
00334 static void *bli_mempool_iternext(BLI_mempool_iter *iter)
00335 {
00336     void *ret = NULL;
00337 
00338     if (!iter->curchunk || !iter->pool->totused) return NULL;
00339 
00340     ret = ((char *)iter->curchunk->data) + iter->pool->esize * iter->curindex;
00341 
00342     iter->curindex++;
00343 
00344     if (iter->curindex >= iter->pool->pchunk) {
00345         iter->curchunk = iter->curchunk->next;
00346         iter->curindex = 0;
00347     }
00348 
00349     return ret;
00350 }
00351 
00352 void *BLI_mempool_iterstep(BLI_mempool_iter *iter)
00353 {
00354     BLI_freenode *ret;
00355 
00356     do {
00357         ret = bli_mempool_iternext(iter);
00358     } while (ret && ret->freeword == FREEWORD);
00359 
00360     return ret;
00361 }
00362 
00363 #else
00364 
00365 /* optimized version of code above */
00366 
00367 void *BLI_mempool_iterstep(BLI_mempool_iter *iter)
00368 {
00369     BLI_freenode *ret;
00370 
00371     if (UNLIKELY(iter->pool->totused == 0)) {
00372         return NULL;
00373     }
00374 
00375     do {
00376         if (LIKELY(iter->curchunk)) {
00377             ret = (BLI_freenode *)(((char *)iter->curchunk->data) + iter->pool->esize * iter->curindex);
00378         }
00379         else {
00380             return NULL;
00381         }
00382 
00383         if (UNLIKELY(++iter->curindex >= iter->pool->pchunk)) {
00384             iter->curindex = 0;
00385             iter->curchunk = iter->curchunk->next;
00386         }
00387     } while (ret->freeword == FREEWORD);
00388 
00389     return ret;
00390 }
00391 
00392 #endif
00393 
00394 void BLI_mempool_destroy(BLI_mempool *pool)
00395 {
00396     BLI_mempool_chunk *mpchunk = NULL;
00397 
00398     if (pool->flag & BLI_MEMPOOL_SYSMALLOC) {
00399         for (mpchunk = pool->chunks.first; mpchunk; mpchunk = mpchunk->next) {
00400             free(mpchunk->data);
00401         }
00402         BLI_freelist(&(pool->chunks));
00403         free(pool);
00404     }
00405     else {
00406         for (mpchunk = pool->chunks.first; mpchunk; mpchunk = mpchunk->next) {
00407             MEM_freeN(mpchunk->data);
00408         }
00409         BLI_freelistN(&(pool->chunks));
00410         MEM_freeN(pool);
00411     }
00412 }
